page.title: 06A Wolds Farm (continued)
page.content:
The grass is then carted back to the farm and stacked in a clamp where it ferments and becomes{silage.}I then wait for it to rain to make the grass grow for the next time. To help it I spread fertilizer on all the grass several times during the summer.
Winter is different and harder. The cows are inside all the time so food has to be taken to them several times a day. They also need bedding. This involves rolling out a large round bale between every 25 cows so that they keep clean.
Most of the cows calve during the winter months so any new arrivals have to be cleaned up and cared for. The calves stay with their mothers for a few hours until they have had a drink of colostrum.(continued)
